author: {'steamid': '76561197996356906', 'num_games_owned': 734, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1676886466}
review:
There was a flash game like this 15 years ago... and then about 10 years ago I had an iOS version of that game but it crashed a lot. I never got to finish those but I'm going to try to finish this one.

However at a certain point the levels get large, it's hard to see enough to plan your moves, and one little mistake and you have to do the whole puzzle from the beginning. At the very least there needs to be a way to move the camera around and a respawn point when you activate a switch.

I'm changing my rating to a thumbs down because after what I consider a reasonable amount of effort I cannot finish it, not because I can't figure out the puzzles but because the quality of life takes a nosedive towards the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216537667', 'num_games_owned': 1998, 'num_reviews': 305, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1685427903}
review:
Chill little puzzle game. Slow paced, no need to rush, but you will need to think 5 steps ahead in many puzzles.
Some puzzles can be very short and quick, others can be very long and complex.
Pacing and difficulty progression in Chapter 1 is good- new functions are introduced in a fairly easy puzzle, with the remaining  puzzles getting progressively more challenging. I'll see how the next 2 chapters are, not long from now. But I don't expect them to get easier- not a game for you if you want super-simple-no-brains-needed puzzles. You will have to think. 

WASD is all you need (or arrow keys), so this is a game that can be played with one hand only. Coffee in one hand, move the block with the other. I have not tried the game with a controller, so I have no clue whether a controller works well or not.
The  colors used are the only major issue I see- this game has no color-blind settings, and some of the puzzles could be next to impossible for people with various forms of color-blindness. There is some slightly annoying music that you can turn down in settings, no audio clues- some sounds when you make a move or use a function/action button in the puzzles- the game is good for Deaf and HoH players, as it can be played with no audio at all without affecting gameplay.

There are some guides if you get stuck or frustrated, but I find that for me, playing 1 or 2 levels at a time while I am waking up with a cup of coffee is a good way to get my brain set for a day  of work, and if I fail a puzzle and have to start that puzzle over- I don't mind. YMMV. It's good for short sessions if you want a logic puzzle game where you can come and go and take your time to work through the 3 chapters of 50 puzzles each.

Not a game for those who want quick-and-easy achievements- this one will take a little while to earn the 3 achievements. 
Game runs perfectly on a toaster or on a beefy high-end build in Windows or Linux Ubuntu. I have had no bugs or issues on either Windows 10 or Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, no special parameters needed, no compatibility mode needed. The full price is good- not too expensive for what you are getting, but on sale- it's a steal if you enjoy these type of puzzle games.

(quick edit to correct a typo- about halfway through Chapter 2 now- working my way through one puzzle at a time. The puzzles aren't much more difficult, but they are longer- many more steps to reach the end.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198080812849', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1652962657}

author: {'steamid': '76561198373330181', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1632862898}
review:
If you're a puzzle addict like myself, get it. It only took me 6.3 hours to 100% it but it was honestly still very challenging. A lot of work clearly went into designing these puzzles and I'm quite impressed.

Also, it worked on Linux Mint for me so that's always a plus. If you get the graphical glitch where the resume/next button's shadow won't go away, exit out and restart the game in windowed mode instead of fullscreen.

You can aim for the goal intuitively.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172925593', 'num_games_owned': 14023, 'num_reviews': 4533, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1612712314}
review:
"3D版推方块"
基本规则就是从上下左右四个方向推动砖块，使得其“滚动”
因为控制的砖块是一个1X2X2的长方体，所以其每次滚动分别会有1X2，2X1和2X2三种着地面
你就是要利用这不同的方向推动使得砖块从起点（绿色）到达终点（红色）

难度比较高，每隔几关会有一些新的玩法，游戏总体质量也不错

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1710619152}
review:
Breezeblox is a console ported retro 2D pixel platformer where you roll a shape around a grid map to get it to the appropriate target space. 

There's not much novel or new here, the game features simplistic graphics and Adobe Flash tier graphics.   It might have been popular/successful on Nintendo but it falls far too low under the mark for a PC game.   This is the kind of thing you can find for free on mobile, so it might be worth going there before spending money on this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075180419', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1157, 'last_played': 1558024423}
review: Breezeblox manages to make a lot out of a little. The visuals are functional, pleasant and very very sparse: bright colours, simple shapes, and fluid animation. Same for the soundtrack, which only features two tracks, one for menus and one for levels (the fact that I played through 150 puzzles without getting annoyed by the backing track is, in its way, a monumental achievement). Gameplay mechanics are likewise simple and limited: four kinds of special blocks add a bit of variety to the get-from-start-to-finish-without-falling-off-the-world routine. Replay value is probably limited, but with 150 levels to play, you'll get your puzzling money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141775948', 'num_games_owned': 1709, 'num_reviews': 323, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1545142002}
review:
オレンジ色の箱を転がして緑地点から赤地点にゴールするゲーム。
全150ステージ。途中からスイッチやワープなどのギミック要素が出てくるがそこまで複雑ではない。
制限時間などは特になく1ステージも1.2分で終わる。
ステージ数は多いが似たようなステージが多くちょっと飽きやすい。
適当に何回かやればクリアできる内容で、爽快感も特になく他のパズルゲームをやった方がマシかなと思った。

author: {'steamid': '76561198379846667', 'num_games_owned': 759, 'num_reviews': 494, 'playtime_forever': 1518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1518, 'last_played': 1543073569}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008332774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 468, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1542063176}
review:
Interesting game, but only for the true fans of puzzle genre. The gameplay is not so exciting and in later levels it gets really tedious, because of how long the levels are. (Total - 150)

Graphics are really simple, controls intuitive and could easily be run on a computer from 12 years ago.

But as I said, only for the true fans of such puzzle games, so don't jump on the shovel too quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061657440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 450, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1541674061}
review:
Dans eden karelere rehberlik edin...

Karşımızda karelerden oluşan bir panel. Hareket ettirdiğimiz dört köreden oluşan bir blok var. Amacımız bu bloğu başladığımız noktadan diğer noktaya götürebilmek. Herhangibir kare boşluğa geldiğinde kaybetmiş sayılıyoruz. Kare blok bitiş noktasına istenildiği şekilde oturtulmadığı sürece de bölüm geçilemiyor. 

Bu tür bulmacalarda başlangıç her zamanki gibi basit olup bölümler ve bulmacalar gittikçe epeyi zorlaşıyor. Oyun üç bölüm ve her bölümde elli seviyeden oluşuyor. Ara zamanlarınızı keyifle değerlendirebileceğiniz bir oyun. Arka plandaki müzikte bence oldukça hoş.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009474997', 'num_games_owned': 2217, 'num_reviews': 1072, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1535888758}
review:
Another indie puzzler, that is both fun, and frustrating, some levels will be easy to just breeze through whilst others will require some extra effort to make it through them.

The gameplay is rather simple, it's a puzzle game that require some strategic thinking to get through it, it really is fun and enjoyable. The levels are really colorful and neatly done making the game visually very appealing which really is nice especially considering that this game isn't expensive , especially consider what it offers. You will have hours of fun and frustration to beat the levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198349440337', 'num_games_owned': 1627, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1643657079}

对了，支持linux这点绝对要给个赞.

author: {'steamid': '76561198832735925', 'num_games_owned': 1860, 'num_reviews': 368, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1534547138}
review: Este juego me recuerda a un juego flash que se llama en internet llamado bloxorz (juegalo si quieres un tipo de demostración de este juego). Ese juego controlas un bloque de 1 por 2 por 1 así que esto no fue difícil de recoger desde que vencí ese juego. Este juego es un pequeño y agradable juego que podría dejarte frustrado contigo mismo, pero una vez que comienzas a pensar en el patrón 2x2x1, el juego realmente brillará. Buena música que fue divertido de escuchar. Sin embargo, a primera vista, ¡hay 150 niveles en este juego !. Si el desarrollador sigue actualizándolo, estoy seguro de que tendremos un gran juego para ti mientras estás haciendo otra cosa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023817849', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1535236264}

author: {'steamid': '76561198342946702', 'num_games_owned': 1335, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1540278744}
review:
Breezeblox ist ein Gelegenheitsspiel und bietet für zwischendurch ein wenig Knobelspaß. Es gibt 3 Erfolge für das erfolgreiche abschließen eines Chapters. Es gibt 3 Chapters mit jeweils 50 Levels. Das Spiel bietet also 150 verschiedene Level. Die einzelnen Level steigern sich im Schwierigkeitsgrad und man brauch viel Geduld und Ausdauer diese zu lösen. 
Wer Knobelspiele liebt, sollte sich das Spiel mal ansehen. Ich finde den Preis zwischen 2-3€ fair.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049173317', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1527535010}
review: Achei top

author: {'steamid': '76561198048842929', 'num_games_owned': 2402, 'num_reviews': 463, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1524396429}
review:
Review verfasst am 22.04.2018

Breezeblox ist ein kleines Puzzlegame, welches drei Chapter mit jeweils 50 Levels hat. Für jeden Chapter gibts bei Vollendung eine Errungenschaft. Also gibts drei Errungenschaften. Wer jedoch meint, diese leicht und schnell zu erhalten, der täuscht sich. Denn die Levels fangen leicht an und werden mit der Zeit sehr schwer. Um die Levels abzuschließen muß man viel rumprobieren. Weshalb man sehr viel Zeit und Geduld mitbringen muß um erfolgreich das Gamae abzuschließen. Ich selber hab noch nicht alles geschaft bin aber noch dran. 

Das Game ist nur für Leute die viel Ausdauer und Geduld haben, alles anderen würde ich Breezeblox nicht empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996964816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1522031375}
review:
Move your awkward shape brick round a tight maze.
Solid puzzle game with a few different mechanics like disappearing blocks, moving blocks, and a teleporter, to keep things interesting for the 50 levels of each section you go through. 
It can get a little samey, it could do with more to it for the length of game it is. 

For the price though, you get plenty of game to get through that can get taxing but never too difficult.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352904065', 'num_games_owned': 2283, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1630058231}
review:
翻滚吧小田田！
慈善包的小游戏，简约的表现，需要开动脑洞才能通关，关卡非常多，平时上班挂着偶尔放松一下非常不错。

author: {'steamid': '76561198048735141', 'num_games_owned': 2348, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1507497409}
review:
Breezeblox is a decent puzzle game, similar to an old game I liked much, called Bloxorz. In both of them player have to move their block-character up to a certain point of the level and put it in there in a particular position. The difficulty is not  to manipulate the character the way to not fall into a depth. Block-character in Bloxorz was made from 2 cubes while Breezeblox gives us 4-cubes-character which makes the game way more entertaining.

There are 150 levels in total in Breezeblox. They are not very hard and do not require any deep-thinking to beat, but they are still interesting. Some less experienced puzzle players will find them difficult for sure.

Graphics is very simple, but such game doesn't need anything more.
Still, I must admit that the screen that appears every time after beating a level is just awful.

The other thing that I would improve is a movement speed. As for me, the block moves a bit too slow and due to this the game was boring for me at some points.

Background music used in Breezeblox gives the game feeling of mystery and fits it well.

Amount of content this game offers is adequate to its price.

Summarizing, Breezeblox is a cheap and good game that I can recommend for those who are not demanding with visual effects and expecting a calm puzzle game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092313524', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1501131655}
review:
Breezeblox is a spatial platform puzzle game where you have to get through each level and onto the red end section without having any part of your orange cube go off the platform. There are different types of blocks that are introduced to make it more challenging as you make your away through the 150 levels.

As far as the positives of this game go, I feel like it was challenging and made me think many steps ahead to successfully get through a section. So based on the description it gave I feel like it delivered on what it promised.

As for the negatives, I have to say that the music and sound effects quickly got annoying and repetitive (they were also uncomfortably loud compared to anything else I would have open at the time). It's also inconvient that you only have the option to turn the music or sound effects on or off (no sliders). Beyond that, what really began to frustrate me as the levels progressed was that if your orange cube went off of the provided platforms it would disintegrate and you would have to start all the way at the beginning again. It started to feel like it was the I Am Bread of the minimalistic puzzle genre. I feel like it would've been better if they just made it so you were phyiscally incapable of going off the edge by bouncing you back to the position you were just in before you flipped over into oblivion.

So overall, I really have mixed feelings when it comes to this game, and if I could give it a neutral rating, I would. Weighing the positives and negatives, I ultimately decided to give it a cautious recommendation. I think this game is only for the very patient or those really starved of puzzle games. I finished the game 100% in about 7 hours which is a decent amount of gameplay for $3, but even then I would maybe consider getting it on a sale because of the negatives I mentioned.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247474588', 'num_games_owned': 1138, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1710306518}
review: 大学时候有点寝室来了一个室友的朋友，他给我介绍了一款游戏叫反转砖块，flash游戏，他说世界上通关的人不超过10个。当时他在我们面前不假思索的翻转砖块在我们看来简直神一般，后来自己也迷上了那款游戏，大概花了一天的时间终于也能够先他那样不假思索的操作了。后来介绍给我好几个女生，现在的老婆就是这款游戏泡到的。这款游戏算是加强版。算是纪念青春上船补票吧。虽然不是原作

author: {'steamid': '76561198130516505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 324, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1497967608}
review:
Breezeblox is a puzzle game in which you control a set number of cubes and need to get the cubes on a platform in a specific orientation.

Pros:
-Game has a large amount of levels (150)
-Cheap and offers good playtime for the amount you pay for it
-Controls are simple, and gameplay is smooth
-It has achievements, which are fairly simple to get (If you are struggling with the puzzles there is a complete guide on how to solve each one)

Cons:
-Game is too difficult for a casual puzzle game player, it requires alot of thought and movement planning. 
-No camera rotation. Would provide for and help alot with seeing what moves you need to make.

This is a solid little puzzle game, worth a look if you are looking for a challenge
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198035285721', 'num_games_owned': 5118, 'num_reviews': 1098, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1470242825}
review:
[h1]"The easy GooCubePlate"[/h1]
Breezeblox is like GooCubelets an easy but challenging 3D blocks puzzler. You control a 2x2 blocks plate by flipover through 150 puzzles, 50 puzzles in each level. There are elements like buttons, switches, teleporters and dropblocks. The difficulty is quite unbalanced. Personally I find the level2 stages more easy than level1 or level3. Unfortunately you can only play levels with one-life runs (if you flipover the abyss everything is reset). Quite unprecise if you control your plate over mousedrags and mistakenly choose the wrong side. But altogether the game is quite fun and not too hard to beat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042406453', 'num_games_owned': 1063, 'num_reviews': 752, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1462124738}
review:
[quote]For more puzzle game reviews, news and everything puzzle-related, follow [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/25928931-Puzzle-Lovers/]Puzzle Lovers[/url] and check out our [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/puzzlelovers]Steam group[/url].[/quote]

a simple concept nicely executed. it's not a particularly difficult game once you get the hang of it, I only got stumped for a while by a handful of the 150 levels, but it should keep you busy for 5-8 hours. I wasn't a fan of the music (it wasn't that bad, but got repetitive very fast), there are no volume sliders and progress is stored in the registry, but these are the only issues I had. if you're into puzzle games, this is a very good choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053653229', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1478775691}
review: I enjoyed the game. Well worth it for the purchase price. The game needs interface improvements. There is a somewhat lack of options and in order to change resolutions you must restart the game. Your required to select a resolution size prior to launching the game. This is somewhat annoying. Considering if you don't like the selected resolution you must restart. Game interface and the level joining relatively easy no complaints. Game just needs better options.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057579648', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1494075558}
review: This game reminds me of a flash game that is on the internet that is called bloxorz (play it if you want a demo type of this game). That game you control a 1 by 2 by 1 block so this wasnt has hard to pick up since i beat that game. This game is a nice little game that could leave you frustrated with yourself but once you start thinking in the 2x2x1 pattern the game will really shine. Great music that was fun to listen to. However at first glance there is 150 levels in this game!. If the dev keeps updating it im sure we will have great little game for yourself while you are doing something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042726862', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1432231794}
review:
Nettes kleines Puzzle Game.

3 Kapitel mit je 50 Level = 150 Levels total.

Ziel des Spiels: Den Viererwürfel vom Anfangsfeld ins Endfeld bringen. Dabei werden mittels Schalter weitere Flächen generiert bzw. Flächen verschoben. Weiteres gibt es auch in einigen Leveln einen Teleportierbutton. Insgesamt ziemlich einfach zu verstehende Spielmeachnik.


Schwierigkeit:
Kapitel 1 beginnt relativ einfach und steigert sich recht langsam. Wird aber nie richtig schwer. 
Kapitel 2 beginnt wieder bei 0 und gleicht eigentlich Kapitel 1.
Kapitel 3 hat etwas schwerere Puzzles, aber nie wirkliche Kopfnüsse.
Insgesamt hätte es meiner Meinung nach etwas schwerer sein können. 

Prinzipiell ist das Spiel aber bugfrei und lässt sich mit WASD sehr einfach und gut steuern. Es wirkt sehr gut getestet und ausgreift. Kompliment an die Entwickler.
Insgesamt habe ich für die 150 Level genau 5 h gebraucht beim ersten Durchlauf. War recht flott unterwegs,

Ich würde das Spiel jedem Puzzlefan ans Herz legen. Es ist vielleicht nicht das allerbeste Puzzlegame aller Zeiten aber den Preis ist es auf jeden Fall wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012705366', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1572604519}
review:
Ein Highlight und ein Beispiel, dass die richtige Idee entscheidend für den Spielspaß ist!
Die Spielmechanik und die verwendeten Elemente sind extrem simpel, die Level steigern sich in ihrer Schwierigkeit und zeihen den Spieler in den Bann. Man will gar nicht mehr aufhören! Bitte mehr davon!
